humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, the sentinel lymph nodes #1 and #3 were positive for metastatic carcinoma. This means that the patient has metastases in at least 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes (N1). The other assessed lymph nodes (right sentinel node #2 and right axilla with 15 negative lymph nodes) do not change the N stage based on the rules provided. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has metastatic carcinoma in 2 out of 16 examined lymph nodes (sentinel nodes #1 and #3) with no evidence of extranodal extension. This corresponds to pN1a (AJCC 8th edition). The other lymph nodes (#2 and right axilla) were negative for tumor (0/15).
